name: Numbers k such that k*(k+1) is primorial (a term in A002110).
comment: a(n) >> exp(n/2); presumably finite. If a(6) exists then a(6) > 10^200000. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 13 2024
mathematica: nn = 1000; MapIndexed[Set[P[First[#2]], #1] &, FoldList[Times, Prime@ Range[nn]]]; Monitor[Reap[Do[(d = Floor@ Sqrt[#]; If[Divisible[#, d], Sow[d]]) &[P[i]], {i, nn}]][[-1, 1]], i] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 14 2024 *)
xref: Cf. A000194, A002110, A002378, A005117, A161620 (resulting primorials).
author: _David James Sycamore_ and _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 13 2024
